p.s: Now I want to focus on the question wetherwhether CPSChild Protective Service should have taken Pearl away from her mother Margot and the trailer park, and put her directly in a foster home in order to help her get better education and prepare her for a better and independent way of life.
On first thought I would have said yes directly.
She would live in a house with no garbage dump next to her home.
Pearl would be in school but legal.
She would be able to find a lot of friends.
Also she would have a mother and a father.
Through getting her child taken away from her, her mother Margot would maybe realise in what conditions she is living and maybe would try to change that.
She could find better work, finish her education, find a place to live and all in all just better her life.
But in view of Helen's character and situation I would say it was a good decision from Margot to hide Pearl.
She knows about her past, she had consistency, and went to school even though she is there illegally.
If CPSChild Protective Service would have put her in a foster home earlier she would have probably had the same development as Helen had.
If she changed foster homes every few months there would not be that consistency she got, while living in the car with her mother.
She also would maybe get bad or even no education at all.
Like Helen she probably would not knew who she is or where she came from.

Living in the car with her mother might not be the best way to grow up, but in the end she is probably better educated and prepared for a better and independent life than Helen who lived in foster homes since she can think.
I think she would have to be very lucky to find a really good foster home with loving foster parents, who really care about her and where she does not only live for four months.
To sum it up Margot made a great decision by keeping Pearl hid from CPSChild Protective Service and developing Pearl to an independent, strong and intelligent girl.
Under the circumstances they lived in Margot prepared her for life than HelensHelen's 17 different foster homes.
I do not agree with the statement that CPSChild Protective Service should have brought Pearl to a foster home.
